attributes.action: Safely equip ALL key workers ASAP
attributes.additional_details:
Provide ALL non-health care key workers with masks and gloves
Provide all health care key workers with effective PPE

Provide a generic lump sum of at least £1000 to each key worker who has no choice but to face the public in these uncertain times

Many of these workers have insufficient protection, yet are required to put themselves in the front line of the Coronavirus pandemic

Provide masks and gloves to All key workers ASAP
Provide the relevant PPE to health care key workers ASAP
attributes.background:
Show appreciation and gratitude to all of the amazing key workers who are risking their lives to ensure we have access to food, sanitation, transport, care and health

Give ALL front line key workers, from shop assistants, binmen, nurses, doctors, carers, bus drivers etc, a generic monetary gift

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action: 

Provide all workers dealing with the public PPE to be protected from COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307866

Protect essential workers from contracting and spreading Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306387

Provide adequate PPE equipment for medical professionals working with COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304243

Provide urgent support and PPE to carers during coronavirus crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312960

Suitable equipment to protect our front-line police officers from COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310079

Fund and provide safety clothing for the supermarket staff on the frontline: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305874

Consider how to compensate key workers for their efforts during Covid-19 crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308172

Make hazard pay mandatory for key workers in the midst of COVID 19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307619

Pay bonus to all key workers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307215

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
